newsitem.title: GERMANY: German BHW heads for billion-mark flotation.
newsitem.headline: German BHW heads for billion-mark flotation.

text.p: German savings bank, finance and insurance group BHW Holding AG said on Monday it would be pricing its shares at between 22 and 28 marks each for its flotation later this month.
Dresdner Bank, one of the lead managers of the flotation, confirmed at a news briefing the total volume of the issue would as a result be well above one billion marks.

BHW, which is one of Germany's leading providers of finance for real estate projects, said the final issue price of shares would be announced on April 26, with full allocation details to be announced the day after.

BHW said that it expected that the flotation of around a 30 percent of its capital would gain it entry into Germany's M-DAX index for medium-sized publicly-quoted companies by the second half of this year.

Signalling interest in developing other activities, BHW management director Reinhard Wagner repeated that BHW was keen to develop a relationship with the currently state-owned Postbank following its planned privatisation.
Wagner said BHW envisaged both groups taking shares in the each other, with BHW having set aside some 500-600 million marks to purchase a stake in Postbank of around 10 percent.
Under the bookbuilding process being employed for the flotation, the share subscription period runs from April 14 to April 25. with an international placement of shares planned.
